org.opends.server.extensions

Class SASLContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opends.server.extensions.SASLContext
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.security.PrivilegedExceptionAction<java.lang.Boolean>, javax.security.auth.callback.CallbackHandler

    public class SASLContext
extends java.lang.Object
implements javax.security.auth.callback.CallbackHandler, java.security.PrivilegedExceptionAction<java.lang.Boolean>
    This class defines the SASL context needed to process GSSAPI and DIGEST-MD5 bind requests from clients.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static SASLContext createSASLContext(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> saslProps, java.lang.String serverFQDN, java.lang.String mechanism, IdentityMapper<?> identityMapper)
      Instantiate a GSSAPI/DIGEST-MD5 SASL context using the specified parameters.
      void handle(javax.security.auth.callback.Callback[] callbacks)
      Process the specified callback array.
      java.lang.Boolean run()
      The method performs all GSSAPI processing.

    • Method Detail

      • createSASLContext

        public static SASLContext createSASLContext(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> saslProps,
                            java.lang.String serverFQDN,
                            java.lang.String mechanism,
                            IdentityMapper<?> identityMapper)
                                     throws javax.security.sasl.SaslException
        Instantiate a GSSAPI/DIGEST-MD5 SASL context using the specified parameters.
        Parameters:
        saslProps - The properties to use in creating the SASL server.
        serverFQDN - The fully qualified domain name to use in creating the SASL server.
        mechanism - The SASL mechanism name.
        identityMapper - The identity mapper to use in mapping identities.
        Returns:
        A fully instantiated SASL context to use in processing a SASL bind for the GSSAPI or DIGEST-MD5 mechanisms.
        Throws:
        javax.security.sasl.SaslException - If the SASL server can not be instantiated.

      • handle

        public void handle(javax.security.auth.callback.Callback[] callbacks)
            throws javax.security.auth.callback.UnsupportedCallbackException
        Process the specified callback array.
        Specified by:
        handle in interface javax.security.auth.callback.CallbackHandler
        Parameters:
        callbacks - An array of callbacks that need processing.
        Throws:
        javax.security.auth.callback.UnsupportedCallbackException - If a callback is not supported.

      • run

        public java.lang.Boolean run()
        The method performs all GSSAPI processing. It is run as the context of the login context performed by the GSSAPI mechanism handler. See comments for processing overview.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.security.PrivilegedExceptionAction<java.lang.Boolean>
        Returns:
        true if the authentication processing was successful.
